title: Seasonal Weekend Boiler Operator
description:
Drew University is seeking a **Seasonal Weekend Boiler Operator** in the **Facilities Department**. This is a part-time, seasonal weekend position. Employee will be responsible for the continuous, reliable and safe operation of all University building hot water and low-pressure steam boiler plants and associated heating systems. Primary duties will include monitoring boiler performance, conducting routine inspections, performing preventive maintenance, and troubleshooting equipment malfunctions. Additional duties may be assigned.


**Key Responsibilities:**

* Operate and maintain single and multiple fuel-fired water and/or fire tube boilers and associated auxiliary equipmentat the central heating plant as well as all other building boiler plants
* Adjusts fuel feeds and the volume and velocity of draft and other firebox variables to achieve maximum combustion efficiency with changing load demands or variations in fuel quality and regularly observes and notes readings on gauges, meters, detectors, recorders, boiler water level indicators, and computer generated and analog displays to detect danger signals in operations
* Does water testing and performs blow-downs as needed for all low-pressure steam boilers
* Maintains documentation regarding EPA, DEP, state, and local codes for compliance
* Completes campus boiler plant rounds in all required campus properties throughout the shift
* Makes logbook entries and conducts maintenance
* Check, record, and report fuel and water levels
* Run weekly Veeder Root report
* Perform minor pipe repairs
* Replace worn parts, including valves, filters and traps
* Keeps boiler and machine rooms safe and clean
* Inspects to ensure proper operation of and fills water softeners around campus
* Maintain correct boiler parts inventory
* Other types of work outside of boiler operations may be assigned, such as basic painting and ceiling tile replacement

**Required Qualifications:**

* High School Diploma or equivalent.
* 5-10 years of experience in boiler operations
* New Jersey Black Seal low-pressure boiler operator license
* Valid US Driver’s License
* New Jersey Underground Storage Tank Operator Certification preferred
* Familiar with building automation systems preferred
* Able to communicate through computer email, telephone, two-way radio systems, and cell phone
* Normal mobility to move around campus and campus buildings
* Able to bend, stoop, twist, climb up and down ladders
* Able to lift and carry 50 pounds, including up and down stairs
* Strong English written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills are required
* The employee is subject to outside environmental conditions
* Able to understand plans, design specifications, and manufacturer's instructions
* Competency in using tools and operating equipment
* A US driver’s license is required; able to drive an automobile, van, light truck, or utility vehicle.


**Skills:**

* Knowledge of safe operating procedures, such as Lock Out / Tag Out
* Ability to understand and apply professional industry standards for installation, repairs, and safety
* Ability to operate power tools and equipment
* Ability to operate computer-based equipment
* Adaptability to work in a diverse environment, focusing on customer satisfaction under high-stress conditions, and organizing an effective response to day-to-day requirements and one-of-a-kind extreme situations
* Knowledge of the operating practices of preventive maintenance

**How to Apply:**


To apply, submit the following materials.

* Cover letter
* CV/Resume
* Graduate Transcript


Contact Information of 3 professional references


Applications will be reviewed upon submission; early applications are encouraged.

**About Drew University:**

*Drew University, a Phi Beta Kappa liberal arts university, includes the College of Liberal Arts, the Drew Theological School, and the Caspersen School of Graduate Studies. Drew is located on a beautiful, wooded campus in Madison, New Jersey, a thriving small town close to New York City. It has a total enrollment of more than 2,200 students and has 143 full-time faculty members, 98 percent of whom hold a terminal degree in their field. The Theological and Caspersen schools offer master’s and doctoral degrees, and the College confers BA and BS degrees in 40 disciplines and offers 61 minors, 18 Dual-Degree programs, and seven New York Semesters.*

***To enrich education through diversity, Drew University is an Equal Opportunity Employer.***

***If selected for hire, a candidate must provide proof of eligibility to work in the United States, following federal and state requirements.***

***These positions are subject to a background check.***

title: Toll Supported Bridge Monitor 2
company: Delaware River Joint Toll Bridge Commission
description:
**SUMMARY**
Responsible to monitor vehicular and pedestrian traffic an all activity along Commission property surrounding the toll-supported bridges via foot patrols. Serve as initial responders to all accidents, incidents, and occurrences on the toll-supported bridges and surrounding Commission property. Communicate and coordinate with Electronic Security & Surveillance to report accidents, incidents, and occurrences. Maintain daily logs and write incident reports for all accidents, incidents, and occurrences at the toll-supported bridges. **MINIMUM EXPERIENCE AND ABILITIES**
High school diploma or general education degree (GED) and two (2) years’ experience preferred in the military, as a first-responder field, or other related fields; or a full-time Toll Collector with the Commission for at least one year. **RESPONSIBILITIES** include the following. Other duties may be assigned.* Provides a highly visible sense of security to prevent and deter potential risks, threats and incidents by performing security and patrols.
  

* Interacts with the public, motoring and pedestrian to identify potential threats.
  

* Prevents individuals from climbing on, over or under bridge structures.
  

* Prevents or assist in attempt to prevent suicides.
  

* Observes traffic and Directs traffic when necessary for bridge maintenance or emergency vehicles.
  

* Prevents overweight and oversize vehicles from crossing Toll supported bridges when assigned.
  

* Assist pedestrians when crossing and guides bicyclist on walking bikes on bridge structure.
  

* Constant vigilance of bride decks, walkways, approaches, and piers for structural damage and irregularities.
  

* Maintains surveillance both visual and video for underage drinking and jumping from bridges.
  

* Monitors for graffiti, vandalism, bridge lighting and signage.
  

* Assist with directions and guidance in tourist information for the public.
  

* Provides first aid and initial response to patrons in need of assistance.
  

* Maintains a log and incidents reports of all activity during duty hours.
  

* Provides assistance with Law Enforcement on local events and archived video request.
  

* Assist emergency responders during accidents and emergency events on the bridge.
  

* Reports power outages and weather conditions to the Primary Control Center (PCC).
  

* Ensure Radio equipment and ESS video monitoring equipment is functioning properly.
  

* Maintains and ensures that the shelter is secure, clean and presents favorable appearance.
  

* Maintains contact with the Bridge Monitor patrol and Assistant Coordinators during shift on all matters not routine to bridge patrol.
  

* Completes all assignments and instructions throughout the chain of command from Director of Security Safety and Training, Program Manager, District Coordinators, Assistant Coordinators and Bridge Monitor Supervisors.
 **QUALIFICATIONS**
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

 **EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE**


High school diploma or general education degree (GED) and two (2) years’ experience preferred in the military, as a first-responder field, or other related fields; or a full-time Toll Collector with the Commission for at least one year. **LANGUAGE SKILLS**


Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos. Ability to write simple correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization.

 **MATHEMATICAL SKILLS**


Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.

 **REASONING ABILITY**


Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed but uninvolved written or oral instructions. Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations.

 **CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS**


Possession of a valid New Jersey or Pennsylvania driver’s license required.

 **PHYSICAL DEMANDS**


The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

  

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools or controls, reach with hands and arms, climb stairs, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl, talk or hear, taste or smell. The employee is frequently required to stand and walk. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move and/or slide up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

 **WORK ENVIRONMENT**


The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

 **ADDITIONAL NOTES**


The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

title: Home Care Intake Specialist (Bilingual: Spanish)
description:
**Company Overview**: True Care is a licensed Home Care Agency providing outstanding homecare service in the New York Metropolitan area. Our passionate dedication to our clients sets True Care apart. We work with our clients individually to ensure their satisfaction and comfort with the paraprofessionals caring for them. It is our mission to continue to raise the standard of homecare services. We are committed to providing the highest level of care by maintaining excellence in staff, procedures, and responsiveness. The True Care team is Healthcare professionals who are committed to helping our patients and caregivers experience the most excellent care.

**Position Title**: Intake Coordinator

**Reports to**: Intake Manager

**Job Summary**: The Intake Specialist works with the patients, referrals, and Community Outreach Representatives to help facilitate setting up services for new and existing clients to receive homecare. He/she is responsible for processing daily referrals received from sources such as hospitals, nursing homes, community physicians, online campaigns and also assist patients with eligibility and guide them through all service options to receive the best care based on their needs.

**Responsibilities include:**

* Consistently maintain a caseload of potential clients and follow up with them on a continued basis
* Be the liaison between the contracts and clients to get them eligible for services
* Schedule nursing assessments as needed to assess patients in their homes
* Screen patients to find out the best level of care; obtain all required paperwork
* Manage the referral intake process from initiation through admission statuses; generate daily referrals through the E-Pace system
* Manage the eligibility process of patients as they enter True Care for homecare services
* Gather patient documentation and obtain any insurance information from the patient to get them cleared for services
* Investigate type and level of insurance coverage to assess patient eligibility for home care services
* Communicate with medical professionals and insurance company personnel to expedite patient eligible into our program
* Analyze weekly status update reports, from all agency contracts and complete all necessary paperwork
* Complete data entry to ensure accuracy of reporting and outcomes and schedule assessments and reassessments of applicants and enrollees using HHA eXchange
* Upkeep timely communication with the Intake Manager, team members, and the marketing team.
* Maintain constant exchange of information with various departments to schedule assessments, and gather required clinical and demographic data from patient and sources
* Maintain effective relations with all agency contacts
* Create, obtain, and track all communication notes for prior and present authorizations.

**Job Requirements:**

* High School diploma from an accredited school/ GED equivalent
* Bilingual in Spanish is required
* Experience working with Epaces & Salesforce is a plus
* Has a sense of urgency in getting the job done
* Personable and professional
* Knowledgeable of CDPAP/ MLTC programs
* Experienced with Intake, or knowledge of the HHA eXchange a plus
* Able to work in a team-building environment

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $26.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Opportunities for advancement
* Paid orientation
* Paid sick time
* Paid time off
* Paid training
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Language:

* Spanish (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Office Manager/Dental Practice Manager
description:
Are you ready to lead a thriving dental practice in Lynbrook, NY? If so, **Perfect Smile Dental Arts** is seeking a dedicated **Office Manager/Dental Practice Manager** to join our team on a **full-time** basis.


But why should you join us? We're glad you asked!


As our Office Manager/Dental Practice Manager, you'll earn a competitive starting pay of **$30/hour DOE**, plus commission. And the best part? We not only prioritize the well-being of our patients but also our employees, which is why we offer **amazing benefits and perks** that include:

* Dental coverage
* Paid time off (PTO)
* Education assistance
* A mentor/apprentice program
* Growth opportunities
* Uniforms
* Company parties
* Bonuses for full-time employees
* Flexible schedules for part-time employees

 **HOW YOU ENSURE SMILES SHINE BRIGHT:**


As our Office Manager/Dental Practice Manager, you'll work a full-time Monday through Friday schedule between 8 AM and 5 PM. Every day, you'll play a vital role in our practice's success. You'll oversee day-to-day operations, including appointment scheduling, patient flow, and staff coordination. You will also ensure compliance with healthcare regulations, handle patient inquiries, manage financial activities, and develop office policies for optimal efficiency. Your role will extend to inventory management, patient record maintenance, and strategic planning to support practice growth. Join us and experience the excitement of leading a top-notch dental team!

 **HOW WE CHANGE LIVES ONE SMILE AT A TIME:**


Perfect Smile Dental Arts is dedicated to providing superior dental care in a warm and welcoming environment. Our mission is to help our community maintain optimal oral health through comprehensive and preventive patient care. We value teamwork, innovation, and patient satisfaction. With us, employees thrive in our cutting-edge, customer-obsessed, and results-driven culture. We provide a supportive workplace where contributions are valued and careers can flourish. Apply now to be part of a team committed to delivering outstanding dentistry services and creating beautiful smiles every day!

 **DON'T LET THIS AMAZING OPPORTUNITY PASS YOU BY!**


Ready to advance your office management career as our Office Manager/Dental Practice Manager? Here's what we need from you:

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Great leadership abilities
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
* 1-3 years of office management experience is required
* Dental or medical office experience is preferred

Having previous management experience and the ability to implement processes with great follow-through skills is desirable. If you meet the qualifications listed above, apply today! Our initial application is quick, easy, and mobile-friendly. What are you waiting for?! Join our dental office for the opportunity of a lifetime!

title: Creole Speaking Receptionist/HR Assistant
description:

We are looking to hire a Creole Speaking Receptionist/HR Assistant for our office in Spring Valley

As a Receptionist/HR Assistant, you’ll play a crucial role in creating a positive first impression for visitors. You’ll greet and direct them appropriately, notify company personnel of their arrival, and maintain security and telecommunications systems.

title: Direct Service Provider P/T Midwood
description:
The mission of CARES (Community Assistance Resources and Extended Services, Inc.) is to assist children and adults with intellectual/developmental disabilities (ID/DD) and/or mental health conditions and their families, in particular, from under-served multilingual communities, access information, obtain resources and services.


**Salary Range:** $16-$18/hr up to 14 hrs a week **Locations:** Midwood, Brooklyn


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**  

As a Direct Support Professional (DSP), you will work with children and their families to provide resources and support, as well as strengthen daily living skills. Applicants can choose to work in our OWPDD program with individuals who have developmental disabilities or in our HCBS program with individuals facing mental health challenges. The services are provided in the client's home or community setting.


Activities as a DSP for the OPWDD program recipients primarily involves teaching them the following: how to accomplish daily living tasks, improve socialization amongst peers, and become acclimated to typical community activities (i.e. traveling, interacting with store staff/community helpers, and adhering to appropriate social boundaries in various settings).


* Assist individuals in meeting their valued outcomes as outlined in their service plan.
* Communicate effectively with families and supervisors.
* Problem solve and communicate with supervisors as concerns arise.
* Complete and submit documentation detailing the activities engaged with the individuals in a timely manner.
* Complete mandatory trainings


**Education and/or Work Experience Requirements:**

* Prefer prior experience providing direct services to individuals with a developmental and/or intellectual disability OR pursuing a degree in education, social work, nursing, or psychology.
* Computer proficiency (MS Office – Word, Excel and Outlook)
* Ability to work independently and to carry out assignments to completion within parameters of instructions given, prescribed routines, and standard accepted practices.
* Applicants must be at least 18 years old and legal to work in the US.
* High school diploma or GED required, Associates or Bachelor's Degree preferred, in some cases a Bachelor's Degree may be required.


**Physical Requirements:**


* Ability to safely and successfully perform the essential job functions consistent with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standards, including meeting qualitative and/or quantitative productivity standards.
* Ability to maintain regular, punctual attendance consistent with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standards.
* Must be able to lift 35 lbs.
* Must be able to talk, listen and speak clearly.
company_description: The mission of CARES (Community Assistance Resources and Extended Services, Inc.) is to assist children and adults with intellectual/developmental disabilities (ID/DD) and/or mental health conditions.

title: Yardi Systems Manager
description:
**Job Title:** Yardi Systems Manager

**Salary Range:** $115,000 - $135,000

**Classification:** Exempt – (Not eligible for overtime)

**Location:** Remote

**Position Summary:**

Dolphin Property Services (Dolphin) is a rapidly expanding and dynamic property management firm servicing the metro New York City affordable housing industry. Dolphin is dedicated to providing exceptional customer service to its residents and is committed to building better communities. With our recent growth, and ongoing expansion plans, Dolphin is seeking a Yardi Systems Manager with deep understanding of Yardi Voyager applications to maintain the system and implement new modules & tools to optimize utilization of the technology. Experience onboarding new properties to Yardi Voyager is a must.

If you excel at solving problems and are dedicated to making a real impact in the NYC affordable housing industry, this is your opportunity. Join us and be part of a team committed to innovation and excellence in the property management industry. Apply now and step into a role where every day brings new challenges and achievements!

**Essential function/Responsibilities, duties include but are not limited to the following:**

* Manage the Yardi property management system, ensuring its optimal performance and utilization across all areas of the firm
* Maintain a thorough understanding of the Yardi database structure and application integrations
* Collaborate with various departments to identify and implement software to improve business processes that aligns with business needs
* Provide ongoing application and general IT support, troubleshooting and addressing end-user issues quickly and professionally
* Contribute to the training and development of end-users to enhance their proficiency in using Yardi and other applications
* Work closely with real estate application vendors to ensure seamless integration with the Yardi system (e.g., AvidXchange, Panini checkscan installation, banking partners)
* Within Yardi, modify account trees and charts of accounts as needed by accounting and asset management teams
* Build and maintain custom menus and permissions across several different security groups
* Remain up to date on Yardi enhancements and plug-ins, rolling out new functionality as needed
* Staying informed about the latest developments in property management software and technology and assessing how they can be applied to enhance Dolphin’s operations
* Position may be required to perform duties outside their normal responsibilities as needed.

**Requirements:**

* Deep understanding of Yardi Voyager and utilization within the property management industry is required; affordable housing experience is a plus
* Experience onboarding new properties to Yardi Voyager is required
* Familiarity with real estate management processes, and financial and operational reporting for multifamily properties is required
* Experience providing remote IT support and troubleshooting end-user issues in a professional manner is required
* Strong understanding of additional Yardi modules (RentCafe, NY Affordable) is a plus
* Experience with dashboards and custom report writing is a plus
* Intermediate or greater SQL experience is a plus
* Excellent problem-solving and customer service skills
* Ability to work collaboratively and communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders
* Experience with software project management and implementation
* Work authorization (required)

**Benefits:**

* Medical coverage for the employee full premium paid by DPS. Coverage starts day 1 of employment.
* Dental
* Vision
* 401k with employer matching
* Basic and Voluntary Life insurance, Long Term Disability (LTD) and Short Term Disability (STD) insurance
* Annual performance-based bonus

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $115,000.00 - $135,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Location:

* New York, NY (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Certified NYS HHAs / PCAs/ CNAs$19-$25 per hour
description:
**ARE YOU A CERTIFIED HHA OR HAVE BOTH PCA & CNA CERTIFICATION LOOKING FOR AN AGENCY WITH MANY AVAILABLE CASES IN THE LOCATIONS WHERE YOU WANT TO WORK? APPLY NOW!**

**DRIVERS WANTED!**

***Sign on Bonuses $500 Live In/ $300 Hourly***

**LIVE IN CAREGIVERS ARE ALWAYS WELCOMED.**

***WE HAVE IMMEDIATE HOME CARE CASES FOR YOU!***

***ALL CAREGIVERS MUST SPEAK, WRITE, READ AND UNDERSTAND ENGLISH.***

***Catch the Excitement at SARA! Call, Apply Online, or Come In Today.***

***We Want to be your #1 Home Care Agency!***

**NEW HOURLY RATES $19 - $25**

**WANT TO MOVE TO THE FRONT OF THE INTERVIEW LINE?** 

**LET US KNOW IF ANY OF THE FOLLOWING APPLY TO YOU:**

* ***I am willing to work at least 2 weekend days once per month.***
* ***I have a valid NYS driver's license, my own vehicle, a clean driving record, and/or I am willing to drive my client in their car as needed. DRIVERS ARE A PLUS.***
* ***I speak English fluently and also speak another language.***

***SARA wants to extend a special invitation to NYS certified HHAs .***

~ We would like you to meet with our management team and find out about all the wonderful things at SARA that make our HHA caregivers happy

~ Higher hourly rates!

~ Immediate cases in Nassau County, Suffolk County and New York City. Flexibility to accept cases where you want them.

~ Many beautiful homes with great clients

~ A clear Caregiver Levels program with easily obtainable promotions

~ Expanded Staffing and Human Resource /Compliance Team

~ Our SARA team is here to answer all your questions and provide friendly assistance to your needs

Apply through Indeed, call or email SiahN@saracompanions.com

**Responsibilities:**

* Assist clients with activities of daily living (Light housekeeping, meal preparation, laundry, grocery shopping etc.)
* Monitor patients report on client condition changes to the Registered Nurse
* Provide companionship and basic emotional or psychological support.
* Maintain a high degree of patient confidentiality at all times due to access of sensitive information.
* Maintain regular consistent attendance, that is flexible to meet the needs of the client.

***PLEASE DO NOT APPLY UNLESS YOU MEET THE QUALIFICATIONS LISTED BELOW!***

**HHA Requirements:**

* Must be 18 and over.
* Ability to follow written and verbal instructions.
* Must have a true desire to care for others.
* Experience with Alzheimer's and Dementia.
* 2+ years of HHA home care experience is required for Certified HHAs.

title: Cleaning Supervisor/Account Coordinator
description:
**Overview:**


Imperial Cleaning is one of the largest independently owned cleaning companies in the nation, providing professional cleaning services to Retail, Offices, Medical Facilities, Schools, Commercial Buildings, Financial Institutions, Municipalities, and more for over 25+ years. Now over 1,000 employees strong, and with consistent double-digit sales growth year over year, Imperial Cleaning is well-positioned to continue its growth.


Should you come to work at Imperial, you will find that we encourage input and creativity from employees at every level within our organization to improve and move our business forward. We welcome new employees to our growing family and team. When you join Imperial Cleaning you become part of a great family culture. At Imperial, we know that our people are our greatest asset, and we take great care to find highly qualified candidates that share our commitment to growth and excellence.


Imperial Cleaning is an equal opportunity employer. We offer competitive compensation packages and a variety of benefits that provide our staff with a safe, respectful, and professional working environment. Our headquarters is located at 151 Dixon Avenue, Amityville, NY, and is an upscale and professional building.

**Job Description:**

- Screening for new Custodial Technicians.
- Train Employees - Janitorial and administrative tasks.
- Schedule staff and ensure coverage.
- Monitoring of time and attendance.
- Manage Employee Callouts.
- Replace custodial technicians or cover accounts.
- Corresponding with Custodial Technicians.
- Report accidents/Injury.
- Submit and deliver supplies as needed.
- Address and resolve any employee performance issues.
- On-Call for Emergency situations/calls - evenings and weekends.
- Notify District or Regional Manager of ALL staffing changes.


Key Requirements:

* Experience with Commercial cleaning industry a plus.
* Must speak fluent English and Spanish.
* Detail oriented and strong communication skills.
* Results oriented: the ability to resolve challenges and emergencies at a moments notice.

title: ABA Behavior Technician/RBT Job (Afternoon Shift)
description:
**Why You’ll Love this ABA Behavior Technician/RBT Job!**

**About Compass:** At Compass ABA, we believe in highly individualized ABA therapy. We take every aspect of our clients' and families' lives into consideration to create tailored treatment plans. Our commitment to excellence is at the heart of everything we do. We believe that learning is a joyous exploration. We don't just teach, we empower, creating a safe and supportive environment where each child can soar to new heights.

As an ABA Behavior Technician with Compass ABA, you'll provide one-on-one instruction in homes or community settings across New Jersey, New York, and New Mexico. You'll help children with autism develop essential skills in communication, social interaction, play, and daily living. Join our team and embark on an adventure that will bring endless joy and fulfillment to your life and the lives of the children you serve!

**Navigate Toward Success with Compass ABA!**

Are you passionate about guiding children towards their fullest potential? Compass ABA is looking for enthusiastic Behavior Technicians/Registered Behavior Technicians (or adventurers at heart!) to join our team and steer the course of ABA therapy with creativity and dedication.

**Compensation:** $20-30

**Job Type:** Part-Time (15-25 hours/week depending on client's schedule)

**Available Shifts:**

* **Afternoons/Evenings:** every day M-F from 2:30- 5:30PM

**We have openings in the following locations:**

* Hackensack, NJ
* Maywood, NJ

**\\*\\*\\*Please note that specific shifts available may vary depending on your location and client needs.** 

**Your Required Navigation Tools:**

* *High School Diploma or equivalent* combination of education, training, and experience. **College Degree preferred**.
* Previous experience working with children or with individuals with autism or related developmental disabilities is preferred.
* Reliable transportation to travel to client homes or other designated locations.
* Ability to pass background check

**Responsibilities of your mission:**

* **Adventure Guide:** Implement direct one-on-one ABA therapy sessions to individuals with autism spectrum disorder under the guidance of a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA).
* **Behavior Navigator & Skill Scout:** Utilize strong problem-solving skills to manage challenging behaviors and work towards improving client’s social and communication skills, as well as their independence.
* **Team Explorer:** Collaborate and communicate effectively with team members and family to ensure effective implementation of behavior intervention plans.
* **Progress Compass**: Collect and record data on client’s progress and behaviors, utilizing information to inform & adjust treatment plans.
* **Compass of Compassion:** Maintain professionalism and a commitment to providing high-quality services, while remaining eager to learn and grow.
* **Calm Captain:** Ensure a safe and supportive learning environment for clients by adhering to all safety protocols and procedures.

**What we Offer for your Voyage:**

* Free supervision hours and training available towards your RBT or BCBA certification!
* Reduced tuition at Felician University or Kean University, our academic partners
* Flexible hours to meet your schedule
* Paid Holidays
* Accrued Sick Time
* Referral bonuses
* Be part of a team that is truly collaborative and focuses on the well-being of our employees, clients and their families!

Set sail with us and help children with ASD find their true north! Apply now to join the Compass ABA crew and embark on a rewarding journey!

**What to expect after you apply?** Apply now and expect a response within 1-2 business days. By applying, you agree to receive communications from Compass ABA.

Compass ABA values a diverse and inclusive workplace, ensuring equal opportunities for employment and advancement for all qualified individuals, irrespective of protected characteristics such as race, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, or any other status recognized by law.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $20.00 - $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: 15 – 25 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Opportunities for advancement
* Paid time off
* Paid training
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program
* Tuition reimbursement

Medical Specialty:

* Pediatrics

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* After school
* Evenings as needed
* Evening shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* What languages are you proficient in?
* Are you physically able to perform necessary duties for the job? If no, please explain.
* Do you have reliable transportation to this job's location?
* Are you willing to undergo a background check, in accordance with local law/regulations?
* What is your zip code?
* How did you hear about Compass ABA?
* Are you available to start working within the next 2weeks (Yes/No)?
* Are you available to work every day M-F from 2:30- 5:30PM (Yes/No)?

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

* Childcare: 1 year (Required)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Clinical Psychologist
description:
For over 25 years, G&A Partners has been helping entrepreneurs grow their businesses, take better care of their employees, and enjoy a higher quality of life by providing proven HR solutions and technology. G&A Partners' client is currently seeking a **Clinical Psychologist** to join its team in **White Plains, NY**.

**Summary**

The Clinical professional is responsible for delivering high quality evidence-based assessment and treatment and training, and promoting high standards of evidence-based training and practice among trainees and staff. The clinical professional is expected to perform direct clinical, training, supervision, and consultation duties in addition to administrative duties. The Clinical Professional will ensure that their clinical professional duties run efficiently and cost-effectively. Moreover, they will serve as an ambassador for the company in their communications and actions inside and out. Other duties may be assigned, as needed.

**Responsibilities:**

As a clinical professional, the clinical professional conducts revenue compensated service requirements that include but are not limited to individual/family/couples/group patient sessions, individual/school/agency/corporation consulting, coaching or sessions, workshops/training sessions, telephone screenings, or testing and evaluations. Toward these duties, the clinical professional is expected to appropriately maintain patient medical records, administrative paperwork, and perform all billing and collection duties in a timely and accurate manner. The clinical professional is also expected to maintain telephone communication with patients, referrants, and other parties involved in a timely manner and is expected to make-up missed sessions when possible by rescheduling patients not seen, as close to their designated missed appointment as possible.

* 24 45-minute Revenue Generating Clinical Service requirement units per week for a total of 47 weeks (RG SUs)
* Conduct individual, family, parenting, and group sessions;
* Provide direct CBT and/or DBT clinical services
* Provide agency/school consultations and conduct trainings (as determined by the Director of Consultation Services and Co-Founders).

**Supervision and Training Responsibilities**

* The clinical professional is required to contribute at least 1 general hour of supervision per week as determined by the Director of Training and if assigned, to attend monthly supervisor meetings and complete tasks and duties related to supervision.
* The clinical professional’s supervisory responsibilities involve, but are not limited to, individual and/or group clinical supervision as well as other training and teaching activities at the company including talks or workshops.
* The clinical professional may receive 1 hour of weekly supervision by a senior staff member up to one year or until the client judges that the clinical professional no longer requires supervision.

**Qualifications:**

* Competency in clinical assessment, diagnosis and treatment is required. This involves didactic training and formally supervised clinical experience over at least a 3-year period with multiple clients in understanding, evaluating, diagnosing, and treating psychopathological disorders.
* Competency in CBT is required. Competency involves didactic training in CBT as well as formally supervised clinical experience over at least a 2-year period with multiple clients in CBT.
* Competency in DBT is strongly preferred. This involves didactic training in DBT as well as formally supervised clinical experience over at least a 1-year period with multiple clients in DBT.
* Experience treating a range of disorders and ages.
* NY State License is current and in good standing
* Strong clinical skills and team orientation
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills, ability to build relationships with staff and other professionals
* Ability to act in accordance with the client’s mission
* Ability to act in accordance with the client's values (kindness, cooperation, good work ethic, collaborative, openness to feedback, ability to be fallible, openness to and nonjudgmental acceptance of diverse viewpoints and individuals, ability to accept nuance and balance perspectives, respect for others, commitment to continuing education and professional development of self and others, and contribution to the common good).

**Education**

* PhD or PsyD in Clinical, Combined School-Clinical Psychology, School or Counseling Psychology highly preferred.
* Master of Social Work (MSW); Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW)

**Compensation:**

* Salary is commensurate with degree type and years of experience.

Equal Opportunity Employer Statement

G&A Partners as an Equal Opportunity Employer considers all applicants and prohibits discrimination of any type on the basis of actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth and pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances. Our management team is dedicated to providing a work environment free of discrimination and harassment based on any of these characteristics. We are committed to this policy and achieving a diverse workforce with respect to recruitment, hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, training, compensation, benefits, employee activities, access to facilities and programs and general treatment during employment.

title: Chronic Care Manager/Medical Assistant-Bilingual Chinese and English-part time
description:
The Chronic Care Manager (CCM) performs care management to Medicare recipients who are chronically ill patients with chronic kidney disease, diabetes mellitus, hypertension and other chronic diseases The Chronic Care Manager works in collaboration and continuous partnership with chronically ill patients and their family/caregiver(s), clinic providers and community resources in a team approach to increase patients’ ability for self-management and shared decision-making. Provides high risk patients with chronic disease management, and liaises between the patient, hospital, physicians’ office, home care agency and other community-based organizations. Also, this position is responsible for assisting in enrolling eligible candidates in the Medicare CCM program.

**Reporting**

Adheres to Asian Community Care Management (ACCM) organizational policies, procedures and guidelines for administrative related issues. Clinical oversight of the telephonic care management and coordination is directed by the patient’s individual physician.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

* Responsible for Medicare chronic care management patients.

· Understands the Medicare Benefit for Chronic Care Management and articulates to the customer/patient the benefits of the program and the impact to their continued wellness plan

· Prescreens potential candidates and refer accordingly for CCM program

· Receives, obtains CCM service consent, and processes client data.

* Validates enrollment of CCM patients, based on patient diagnoses.

· Enters all information accurately and promptly into the electronic comprehensive care plan according to Asian Community Care Management (ACCM) processes and procedures.

· Acts as a resource to others and assists with clinical oversight to ensure all elements of CCM are met.

* Conducts 20-30 minutes of telephonic counseling and education per month to each CCM patient on roster.
* Complies with documentation requirements of the Chronic Care Management program by carrying out the care plan with the patient, family/caregiver(s) and providers and recording in the EHR.
* Monitors adherence to care plans, evaluate effectiveness, monitors patient progress in a timely manner and facilitates changes as needed.
* Creates an ongoing process for patient and family/caregivers(s) to determine and request the level of care coordination support they desire.
* Facilitates patient access to appropriate medical and specialty providers.
* Educates patient and family/caregiver(s) about relevant community resources.
* Assist with the identification of “high-risk” patients (the chronically ill and those with special health care needs) and assist on the enrollment of these to the patient registry.
* Coordinates continuity of patient care with external healthcare organizations and facilities including from the primary care provider to a specialty care provider.
* Supports patient self-management of disease and behavior modification interventions.
* Provides patient health counseling, education and instruction.

· Documents all communication and coordination of patient contact in electronic documentation system including aggregation and clinical summaries.

· Assures documentation includes tracking and time-stamping to support billing for CCM.

· Completes and answers patient calls related to CCM activities.

· Is skilled in the use of the electronic documentation for CCM.

· Provides consultative support and training to staff in required elements, documentation and coordination.

· Establishes and maintains positive relationships with all internal and external customers. Responds to customer requests and concerns.

· Documents all concerns and follow-up and escalates to the Clinical Team when appropriate.

**Qualifications**

Experience/Education/Certification/Licensure:

· Active nurse license (RN, LPN, NP); compact license encouraged

· Current Medical Assistant Certification (CCMA) with a minimum 3 years of chronic disease management experience

· Knowledgeable in care planning

· Understands the Medicare benefit for Chronic Care Management (CCM) and can articulate to the customer/patient the benefits of the program and the impact to their continued wellness plan.

· Self-motivated and able to work independently.

· Ability to work from home

· Ability to travel as needed.

· Access to fast speed internet

· Computer skills are required to operate in the customer service platform.

· Extensive EHR experience preferred.

· Home office that facilitates the maintenance of HIPAA and Privacy

Skills:

* Strong organizational and interpersonal skills
* Excellent customer service skills demonstrated by positive feedback from patients/team.
* Ability to identify problem and recommend solutions
* Ability to read, write and communicate effectively orally and in writing
* Knowledge of basic arithmetic
* Basic computer skills

Physical abilities:

* Sit or stand for extended periods of time; push, pull and reach; occasionally bend, sit, stoop and stretch
* Have full range of body motion
* Have the hand-eye coordination and manual dexterity needed to operate a keyboard, photocopier, telephone, calculation
* Have a normal range of hearing and eyesight to record, prepare and communicate appropriately

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $20.00 - $25.00 per hour

Medical Specialty:

* Home Health

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* medical assistant or Chronic Care Manager: 1 year (Preferred)

Language:

* Cantonese (Preferred)
* Chinese (Required)

License/Certification:

* Medical Assistant certificate (Required)

Location:

* New York, NY 10001 (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10001

The Account Executive (AE), as the liaison between clients and internal agency departments, manages deliverables and deadlines. The AE also works with project management (PM) to align with client processes and timelines. The AE also works with project management to ensure agency work is developed in alignment with client processes and timelines.  

What you would be responsible for:* Understands and operates within established client and agency processes
* Partners with PM to meet financial deliverable dates for estimates, invoices, and budgets
* Attends and participates in regular meetings with finance and PM
* Owns and generates internal trackers and client reports with oversight
* Supports account team from creative brief development through final output
* Attends client meetings and participate as appropriate
* Prepares concise and accurate status and contact reports, and outline decisions made on next steps, key dates, and deliverables
* Aligns day-to-day project tasks with timelines, budget, and quality standards

* Provide prompts, well-thought-out responses to project requests and follow up questions
* Collaborates with cross-functional team daily to improve efficiency in status meetings

* Develops and maintains positive professional relationships with internal agency members

* Develops in-depth knowledge of assigned category and stay up to date on relevant brand/category information


What you bring to the table:* At least 1 year of professional work experience, ideally within an agency/marketing role

title: Academy Administrator
description:
**JOB TITLE:** Academy Administrator  

**DEPARTMENT:** Sporting  

**LOCATION:** City Football Academy; Orangeburg, NY and St. John’s University, Queens, NY  

**REPORTING TO:** Director, Academy Administration  

**POSITION OVERVIEW:**
As Academy Administrator you will help facilitate the daily administration, equipment, operations and logistics of the Academy. You are responsible for organizing the processes involving team travel to tournaments and travelling during the MLS Next program. This position involves domestic and foreign travel and the ability to maintain a schedule in line with a professional sports team, including weekends and nights.  

**WHAT YOU’LL DO:*** Lead day-to-day administration and operations of U15 and U17 Academy teams
* Manage all activities for U15 & U17, including:
	+ Games program
	+ Tournaments
* Regular attendance at St. John’s University for U15 and U17 training
* Main point of communication for outside stakeholders with U15 & U17 (including parents, MLS Next, tournament organizers etc.)
* Ensuring all staff, players and parents are aware of and compliant with all Club and Competition guidelines and rules.
* Work closely with the Director of Academy Administration on budgeting and any operational costs align with the overall Academy budget
* Lead preparation for in-season travel, including but not limited to: Flights, Hotels, Transportation, Training sessions
* Responsible for the registration of all players and staff in the Academy for MLS Next, tournaments etc.
* Lead communication with staff, players and parents regarding equipment needs and sourcing from Equipment Coordinator
* Keep all training materials and equipment – e.g. goals, pinnies, balls etc. at SJU – up to date
* Communicate with Academy Director, HR, Head Coaches, 1st Team Performance Director, MLS2 Coaches and Staff, Academy parents.
* Other duties as directed by the Academy Director and Director of Academy Administration.

  

**WHAT YOU’LL BRING:*** Highly proficient in all Microsoft Suite applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook)
* Effectively communicates with a variety of groups such as senior management, peers and parents
* Ability at prioritize and handle multiple assignments while maintaining commitment to deadlines
* Experience working in the sports and entertainment industry preferred

  

**ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:*** Applicant must be able to comply with MLS Next Safety and Well-Being policy and any other applicable child safety policies provided to applicants by NYCFC
* Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends, and holidays, as necessary
* New York City Football Club requires a COVID-19 vaccination as a condition of employment, subject to exception under applicable law

  

**COMPENSATION:**
This exempt position has an estimated annual base salary of $52,500. Final compensation offer amounts are based on a wide array of factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to demonstrated skill set, years and depth of relevant experience, and some role-dependent factors such as certifications and software expertise. We welcome direct conversations with each candidate about compensation in all of our initial calls.  

**WHAT WE OFFER:*** Excellent health, dental & vision insurance, with options to fit you and your family’s needs
* Comprehensive and competitive benefit programs, including maternal & paternal leave
* Ancillary benefits: Commuter, gym membership, and Citi Bike discounts
* Your health is important! Our wellness strategy focuses on mental and physical wellbeing through in-office and virtual programs
* Four complementary tickets to every NYCFC home match
* Team outings, happy hours, and annual staff gatherings to celebrate our co-workers
* A dynamic, ambitious, and fun work environment

 **NEW YORK CITY FOOTBALL CLUB OVERVIEW:**
At New York City FC, we are on a mission to build this City into one of the soccer capitals of the world. The Club was announced as Major League Soccer’s 20th franchise and is the first and only MLS team located within the five boroughs of New York City.
The Club consistently finishes at the top of the Eastern Conference and most recently won the Campeones Cup in 2022 along with the MLS Cup in 2021. The games are broadcast locally through YES Network with national television coverage through ESPN, Fox and Univision. New York City FC ranks in the top five of key commercial categories for Major League Soccer franchises: season tickets, attendance, gate receipts, partnerships and retail merchandise sales. The franchise’s social media platforms are already in the top two most-followed in MLS for Instagram, Twitter and Facebook. For more information, please visit: https://www.nycfc.com/ .  

New York City FC is also one of ten clubs comprising City Football Group and counts Manchester City FC, Melbourne City FC, Yokohama F-Marinos, Girona FC, Montevideo City Torque, Sichuan Jiuniu FC, Mumbai City FC, Lommel SK and Espérance Sportive Troyes AC among its sister clubs.  

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
